intro: Pleurothallis rhodocardia, commonly known as the red-veined orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pendulous inflorescences. The plant typically produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, with intricate veining patterns. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated by enthusiasts for its unique floral display.
